title: OCE tracert sumbitted by riot doesn't work for me, need help
body:
The OCE tracert ping test from the LoL website here: "https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2" doesnt do anything in my CMD. As in when i press enter it goes down a line and nothing ever happens. Also it is run as administrator just so you know.

When i run a ping test to that OCE IP address with cmd it says "request timed out" 
(ping test being this in cmd: "Ping 103.240.227.5 -n 25 -l 500")

My issue is that up until a few days ago i had a playable ping of under 100 and now it is stuck at over 200 constantly. So i want to run a tracert so i can see where in the line there is an issue. but when i copy/paste this:      (tracert 103.240.227.5) > "%USERPROFILE%\desktop\Tracert.txt"        into cmd it doesnt do anything. hence this post. 
I cant play league of legends with my current ping, and i dont know what to do. 
Any help would be Highly appreciated, Thanks.

replies.body:
Hey there,

First off, the response you receive when you attempt to ping the OCE server IP's directly is intended, these servers do not respond to ICMP requests.

Could you do the following for me;

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the url to your ICSI netalyzr results.

apologies for the bad formatting (tried to fix it with spaces, doesnt show up in preview). im clearly getting some big ping spikes but regardless the averages are no higher than 60, where as in game ping is still stabilizing around 220. im not sure how that correlates but i ran the test for about 20 mins.

Hey there,

Apologies for the delayed response.

If you're still experiencing this issue, there's a few things you could try.

* Your traceroute shows some minor packet loss along the way that appears to originiate from yours and your ISP's end of things. I would recommend the following.
  * Switch to a wired connection if you're not already on one.
  * Contact your ISP regarding your connection issues.

The below are more than likely not related to your connection problems but I would recommend doing them anyway.

* [Switch to a public DNS.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Sync your windows clock.](http://www.guidingtech.com/3119/windows-clock-sync/)

here is ICSI netalyzer results:

sorry for reply spamming you

EDIT - ignore between [ ]
[I do have winMTR (i forgot must have downloaded ages ago for WoW) but before i do this i have to tell you that i also tried to run ICSI netalyzer yesterday and updated my java fully but i cant seem to get it to work, that is, there is no start button even after updating java fully. I know this may be an issue because this is third party to you and i tried googling around but it doesnt seem as though anyone else gets that circumstance... so im not sure where to go from there so if you could recommend a work around that would be awesome]

Am proceeding to begin win MTR test now though and will post when ready. 
thanks
